body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.2.1-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team


## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Create a workspace.
3. Go to workspace chat.
4. Submit an expense to the workspace chat.
5. Go to Reports > Expenses.
6. Paste type:expense,car,group-by:report on the search field

## Expected Result:
As `type:expense,car,group-by:report` is an invalid search, we should go to the "Oops!" invalid search query page. 

## Actual Result:
Page loads infinitely on searching type:expense,car,group-by:report

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Unify UI filter experience for all numerical filters

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
At the moment our amount filters use the following approach to mimic `total>X` and `total We actually already support "exact" dates via the `On` filter. So in this issue, we're going to do similar and make it easier to search for exact amounts for any numerical filter. More specifically, we will: - Update the `Amount`, `Total`, and `Purchase amount` filters (some currently being worked on). - Show `Equal to`, `Greater than` and `Less than` push rows - Make the input focused on the page, and only accept numerical values To keep things simple we won't yet add support for `Greater than or equal to` or `Less than or equal to`. We can re-evaluate this decision in the future.
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @hungvu193

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.1-12 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @VickyStash **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Open source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1756980523424439) ## Action Performed: 1. Login with the new account. 2. Create a workspace. 3. In the workspace chat create 2 expenses and 1 additional report 4. Open any 1-1 chat and create 2 expenses as well 5. Go to Reports tab -> Reports 6. Using checkboxes select the expense from 1-1 chat and put in on hold. 7. Using checkboxes select the expense from workspace chat and Move it to the empty report from step 3. 8. Go back to the chats tab to the workspace chat. See that the expense was moved successfully. ## Expected Result: Moved expense shouldn't have "This expense was put on hold." message ## Actual Result: Moved expense has "This expense was put on hold." message. It disappears if I open the expense and go back ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

## Action Performed:
Break down in numbered steps

1. Have a workspace setup with max daily amount for expense
2. Scan a receipt that has amount over that allowed amount
3. Verify that once scanned the violation shows on the report preview on the workspace chat

Onyx state and data here:

https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1756988912689619?thread_ts=1756736470.652199&cid=C05LX9D6E07

## Expected Result:
Describe what you think should've happened

The transaction thread should show in the LHN with RBR

## Actual Result:
Describe what actually happened

The report is not showing in the LHN

## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

body:
Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1749629334304079

Using the `npm run web:prod` seems to not work reliably and the app runs into the 404 issues. Let's make sure this flow works and developers can run and test the production web build
